bug.author: amarrella
bug.summary: kfctl v0.5.1 binary not working for AWS
bug.description:
It looks like kfctl v0.5.1 binary doesn't support --provider aws while the source code tagged as v0.5.1 does. Also when I run: <denchmark-code>./kfctl version </denchmark-code>
it seems to get an old dirty version: <denchmark-code>v20181207-4e7f4ed-198-gaeea303e-dirty-03e65e </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.89. Please mark this comment with ğŸ‘ or ğŸ‘ to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

AWS currently still uses kfctl.sh Migrating to kfctl is <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/issues/2998>#2998</denchmark-link>
The --version issue is <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/issues/2986>#2986</denchmark-link>
/cc <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Jeffwan>@Jeffwan</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/amarrella>@amarrella</denchmark-link> Let's keep track of the issue here <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/issues/3332>#3332</denchmark-link>
